title: Flan de Coco (Coconut Flan) Recipe
description: This flan de coco is made with shredded coconut, eggs, and evaporated and condensed milks for a rich, creamy custard with enticing tropical flavors.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Custards and Puddings Flan Recipes Flan de Coco (Coconut Flan) 4.7 (128) 104 Reviews 18 Photos This flan de coco is a delicious, tropical coconut dessert with flavors of the Caribbean! Submitted by Esther Updated on May 9, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 18 18 18 18 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Additional Time: 8 hrs 45 mins Total Time: 9 hrs 55 mins Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 ½ cups white sugar, divided 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk 6 large eggs ½ cup milk ½ cup fresh shredded coconut Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place 1 cup sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook gently without stirring, but shake occasionally until sugar is melted. Continue cooking until sugar turns golden brown, then pour into a large glass baking dish. Rotate and tilt the dish to spread caramel evenly over the bottom. Set aside for caramel to cool and harden, about 15 minutes. Add condensed milk, evaporated milk, eggs, milk, coconut, and remaining 1/2 cup sugar to a blender. Blend until smooth, about 3 minutes. Pour over hardened caramel in the baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until custard is set, about 45 minutes. Allow flan to cool for 30 minutes at room temperature. Run a knife around the edges of the dish to separate the flan from the sides. Refrigerate until completely chilled, 8 hours to overnight. To serve, carefully invert flan onto a rimmed serving plate; let caramel sauce flow over flan. I Made It Print 206 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 297 Calories 9g Fat 47g Carbs 8g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 297 % Daily Value * Total Fat 9g 12% Saturated Fat 5g 26% Cholesterol 114mg 38% Sodium 115mg 5% Total Carbohydrate 47g 17% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 47g Protein 8g 17% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 201mg 15% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 278mg 6% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Add Your Photo Photos of Flan de Coco (Coconut Flan) 01 of 18 Photo by  Maria Victoria Dajud 02 of 18 Photo by  CookingABCs 11/28/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Great flavors Crowd-pleaser Family favorite Excellent & easy to follow! to bring out the coconut flavor for those who say it’s subtle this time I made it with coconut evaporated milk, and Coconut condensed milk Along with the coconut flakes, which I upped to a cup. on previous occasions that I’ve made this recipe to the letter, it’s been a hit with the family. Family wanted seconds with this version. 03 of 18 Photo by  Maria Victoria Dajud 09/28/2020 Perfect flan! I followed the advise to replace 1 can evaporated milk with 1 can coconut milk. The texture was PERFECT. I also used the tip to bake it in a water bath and did not over bake. No leftovers!! 04 of 18 Photo by  MPear 09/20/2018 05 of 18 Photo by  shannon 07/21/2018 I made this exactly according to the directions. What a disaster. Directions say to run a knife along the sides and refrigerate overnight. Needless to say, the Carmel rehardened and now it is stuck in the pan as you can see. If I was supposed to turn out before refrigeration, the directions should have said so. 06 of 18 Photo by  shannon 07/21/2018 I made this exactly according to the directions. What a disaster. Directions say to run a knife along the sides and refrigerate overnight. Needless to say, the Carmel rehardened and now it is stuck in the pan as you can see. If I was supposed to turn out before refrigeration, the directions should have said so. 07 of 18 Photo by  shannon 07/21/2018 I made this exactly according to the directions. What a disaster. Directions say to run a knife along the sides and refrigerate overnight. Needless to say, the Carmel rehardened and now it is stuck in the pan as you can see. If I was supposed to turn out before refrigeration, the directions should have said so. 08 of 18 Photo by  sanogr8 07/08/2016 09 of 18 Photo by  mikeyismikey99 06/24/2015 10 of 18 Photo by  LatinaCook 05/28/2012 My favorite coconut flan is the one on this site by Milly Suazo (Coconut Cheese Flan). However, that one calls for cream cheese and I was making a flan for a friend who doesn't care much about cream cheese. So, I decided to give this one a try. I wanted the coconut flavor to be noticeable so I did as many suggested and replaced the evaporated milk with a 14 oz can of lite coconut milk and omitted the extra regular milk. The flan came out good but I wasn't wowed by it. Everyone else seemed to enjoy it a lot. I think the coconut flavor didn't stand out as much as it could have. Also, flans are made in a water bath, please don't skip that step. I've made hundreds of flans over the years and for the last 15 years I have always made the caramel in the microwave. Put the sugar and some water in a Pyrex cup and heat on high for 10-15 minutes until it turns amber. Handle with care. You can use that same caramel to make decorations for the flan. Wait until it starts to harden a bit and drizzle it on top of parchment paper. When it dries up (in a minute or two) you can lift up the decoration and use it to top the flan once you have flipped it and it's ready to be served. 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Coconut Flan 50 Ratings Coconut Milk Flan 17 Ratings Pina Colada Flan 9 Ratings Aracely's Flan 40 Ratings Creamy Caramel Flan 705 Ratings Flan de Queso (Cream Cheese Flan) 64 Ratings White Chocolate Flan 4 Ratings Super Easy Cream Cheese Flan 5 Ratings Mango Pudding (Flan de Mango) 19 Ratings Pumpkin Flan Caramel-Glazed Flan 119 Ratings Microwave Flan 25 Ratings Baked Flan 514 Ratings Coconut Cheese Flan (Flan de Coco y Queso) 47 Ratings 7 Absolutely Irresistible Mexican Flan Recipes Simple and Creamy Spanish Flan 9 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Esther
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Place 1 cup sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook gently without stirring, but shake occasionally until sugar is melted. Continue cooking until sugar turns golden brown, then pour into a large glass baking dish. Rotate and tilt the dish to spread caramel evenly over the bottom. Set aside for caramel to cool and harden, about 15 minutes.;Add condensed milk, evaporated milk, eggs, milk, coconut, and remaining 1/2 cup sugar to a blender. Blend until smooth, about 3 minutes. Pour over hardened caramel in the baking dish.;Bake in the preheated oven until custard is set, about 45 minutes. Allow flan to cool for 30 minutes at room temperature. Run a knife around the edges of the dish to separate the flan from the sides. Refrigerate until completely chilled, 8 hours to overnight.;To serve, carefully invert flan onto a rimmed serving plate; let caramel sauce flow over flan.
